column4: i'm having the problem with eth0 and eth1 switching.  the mac addresses on the cards are the same, so i can't use /etc/iftab to fix it.  anyone have a suggestion ?
The MAC addresses on the cards can't be the same.
the mac addresses on the cards ARE the same.  i'm sure
No two networking cards, no matter what brand or model will ever have the same MAC address.
mine do...  would you like to see the output from ifconfig ?
yeah, by default.  i set the mac address in them using ifconfig.
Post your ifconfig files on pastebin
ifconfig eth0 hw ether 34:52:8C:F3:D0:B8
that does it.  any address would work as long as its valid
Pastebin the output
why do you want the output ?  i guess i will..  what is pastebin url ?
done.  under name duplicate_mac_address
What's the URL
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/30833/
i pasted the command to do it above.  the command i use
How many network cards you have in your system?
Any onboard?
yeah
Check out the man page for iftab...look for the "arp" selector...could that be of any help?
yeah, i saw in the man page i can identify them by driver.  i'm gonna do that.  also you can id them by other stuff
good luck :)
When I first started Ubuntu I was discouraged from using Automatix by the channel.
how come ?
Probably something to do with what fishsticks said.
